data.title: Bike Race Results, 2002
data.text:
Results of important international bike races for 2002. Results are in date order, most recent first. Giro, Tour, and Vuelta results are on their own pages.

Saturday, October 19: Giro di Lombardia, World Cup Round 10, 251 km

Giro di Lombardia podium history

2002 Giro di Lombardia results

Thursday, October 17: Giro del Piemonte (1.1) 193 km.

1. Luca Paolini (Mapei) 4hr 42min 27sec

2. Matthias Kessler (Telekom) s.t.

3. Gianluca Bortolami (Tacconi) s.t.

2. Oscar Camenzind (Phonak) s.t.

3. Gabriele Missaglia (Lampre) s.t.

4. Davide Rebellin (Gerolsteiner) s.t.

World Championships: Zolder, Belgium

2002 World Cycling Championships results

Giro dell'Emilia podium history

2002 Giro dell'Emilia results

Thursday, September 26: Coppa Sabatini (1.2) 198 km. Mr. Bettini appears to be ready for the World Championships. This will again make for very interesting politics within the Italian squad with Bettini and Cipollini in superb form and neither likely to make sacrifices for the other. The Italians may again race as individuals rather than as a unified squad.

1. Paolo Bettini (Mapei) 4hr 30min 31sec

2. Andrea Ferrigato (Alessio) s.t.

3. Roggero Marzoli (Formaggio Trentini) s.t.

4. Michael Boogerd (Rabobank) s.t.

Sunday, August 18: Meisterschaft von Zurich (Championship of Zurich), World Cup Round 8, 236.6 km. Scheduled to ride: Bettini, Evans, Freire, Julich, Livingston, Armstrong, Landis, Vainsteins, Museeuw, Merckx, Virenque, Zulle, Escartin, Bartoli, O'Grady, Jalabert, Rebellin, Van Petegem, Tonkov, Dekker, both Zbergs, DiLuca, Frigo.

Results: Dario Frigo soloed with about 18 kilometers to go. His chasers never got organized. Frigo's sit-up win was his 1st World Cup victory and his 7th win this year. Johan Museeuw, who had been leading the World Cup competition abandoned. Paolo Bettini is now the leader in the World Cup by 2 points.

1. Dario Frigo (Tacconi) 5hr 56min 54sec

2. Paolo Bettini (Mapei) @ 1min 7sec

3. Lance Armstrong (US Postal) s.t.

4. Massimiliano Gentili (Acqua Sapone) s.t.

5. Carlos Sastre (CSC-Tiscali) s.t.

6. Michele Bartoli (Fassa Bortolo) s.t.

9. Ivan Basso (Fassa Bortolo) s.t.

10. Laurent Dufaux (Alessio)

Saturday, August 3: Karlsruhe Versicherungs Grand Prix 2-Man Time Trial (1.2). 6 x 12km laps, 72 km Total. Rich and Peschel have both won this event in the past with other partners. They flatted, but still beat the Jalabert brothers and the 8th place Armstrong/Landis duo.

Sunday, May 5: Giro di Toscana (1.3), 194 km. Starts at Chianciano, south of Cortona and finishes at Arezzo. They will go up the Scopetone 4 times. I don't have an elevation, but the road map shows 7% -12% rise on the climb.

Saturday, May 4: 20th GP Industria & Artigianato, 200 km. This is set just west of Florence. A good field is scheduled to race, including: Simoni, Perez-Cuapio, Gotti, Bettini, Garzelli, Casagrande and Basso. This is the last weekend to get in racing miles before the Giro starts.

1. Stefano Garzelli (Mapei) 5hr 14min 2sec

Saturday, March 2: GP Citta di Chiasso (1.3). 175.8 km.The race starts on the shore of Lake Lugano in the city of Campione d'Italia. It heads down the shore line, then cuts across to Chiasso for a couple of circuits before finishing in the city square. Most of the big guns are at the Het Volk and Valencia, but this will also be a quality race. Among those scheduled to ride:

Gerolsteiner: Rebellin

Telekom: Livingston

Alessio: Dufaux, Gotti

Saeco: Celestino

Credit Agricole: Brard, Voigt

Fakta: Sunderland

Tacconi: Mazzoleni

Km 108: 3rd cat Puerto de montemayor, 920m.

Km 238: 3rd cat Alto de Matel, 630.

Then a descent to 350 m elevation at the finish.

Sunday, February 24: Trofeo Luis Puig (1.2). Valencia - Beniform, Spain. 180.3 km. Scheduled to ride: Zabel, Zulle, Cipollini, Casero. The race starts at 10 meters elevation. The first difficulty is a category 3 climb at km 64, then one at km 85. At km 115, the hardest climb is a cat 2 rising to 960 meters with a drop to near sea level again. Just 8 km before the finish, the final difficulty is a category 3 hill rising to 270 meters, with a descent to 50 m. elevation at the finish.

1. Sergei Ivanov (Fassa Bortolo) 4hr 24min 24sec

2. Rolf Aldag (Telekom)

3. Erik Zabel (Telekom)

4. Mario Cipollini (Aqua Sapone)

Tuesday, February 19: Trofeo Laiguelgia (1.3), 177.6 km. La Gazzetta Dello Sport says that Michele Bartoli, after his bath in champagne after his victory in the Tour of the Mediterranean, has been cleansed of his 3 years of misfortune and bitterness. That writing and sentiment is pure Italian. But, the Gazzetta believes the Tuscan racer is in the "Pole Position" at the start of the race, even with such powerful competitors as Simoni, Bettini, Di Luca, Rebellin and Jalabert on the line.

1. Danilo Di Luca (Saeco) 4hr 29min 36sec

2. Eddy Mazzoleni (Tacconi) s.t.

3. Serge Baguet (Lotto) s.t.

4. Fausto Dotti (Cage) @ 3sec

5. Michele Bartoli (Fassa Bortolo) s.t.
